details: 2,000 ft. of school, child care facility, resident camp facility, victim or victim’s immediate family; exceptions apply. §15- 20A-11. Additional restrictions apply to residence with any minor.
2,000 ft. of elementary or secondary school, public park, day care center, youth center. L3 & L4 offenders: 2,000 ft. of victim. L4 offenders: 2,000 ft. of church

2,000 ft. of schools and parks. §3003.5(b). NOTE: this statute was declared unconstitutional as applied to certain parolees by In re Taylor, 60 Cal. 4th 1019 (2015) and is no longer being enforced by the state. However, local governments may enforce this statute or local ordinances.
May not reside or loiter within 500 ft. of school property. §1112.
May not reside within 1,000 ft. of school, child care facility, park, or playground under certain circumstances. §775.215

May not reside, loiter, or be employed within 1,000 ft. of child care facility, church, school, or area where minors congregate. Certain other employment restrictions apply. §§42-1-15 through 42-1-17.
May not reside or loiter within 500 ft. of school, and may not reside within more than one person also required to register, with certain exceptions. §§18-8331, 18-8332.
“Child sex offender” may not reside w/in 500 ft. of school, park, playground, or facility where minors gather. §730 I.L.C.S. §150/8.
Paroled registrants face certain residence restrictions. §11-13-3-4.

Registrants with convictions of involving minors for “sexual abuse” in the 1st or 2nd degree, or in the 3d degree except for a conviction under I.C. §709.4(2)(c)(4), may not reside w/in 2,000 ft. of daycare center.
None, and local residence restrictions are expressly prohibited by K.S.A. §22-4913.
1,000 ft. of schools, day care facilities, and publicly owned playgrounds; must move out of residence within 90 days if a new residence opens. §17.545.
Residence and presence restrictions apply to certain registrants convicted of offenses involving victims under the age of 13. §14:91.02

For registrants convicted after June 30, 1992 of an offense against a person younger than 14, Maine prohibits the knowing initiation of contact with a person younger than 14 in a “sex offender restricted zone,” unless the parent consents or the contact is for employment purposes.
may not knowing enter school grounds or property containing a child care home or child care institution. §11-705.
1,000 feet of “student safety zone,” i.e., a school, with certain exceptions. §§28.734, 28.736. Those convicted when residing in a student safety zone have 90 days to relocate. §28.735(4).
1,500 ft. of school; child care facility; “residential child-caring agency;” a children’s group home; or playground, ballpark, or other recreational facility used by children. §45-33-25.
Certain offenders may not reside w/in 1,000 ft. of school or child care center. §566.145.
Nebraska has a statute preempting local residency restrictions except in certain narrow circumstances (e.g., 500 ft. exclusion zones applicable to SVPs). §29-4017.
Certain laws may impose a 1,000 ft. residency restriction from schools and child care facilities for registrants on parole or probation.
1,000 ft. of school or child care center, with exceptions. §14-206.16.
May not knowingly enter school without permission, subject to exceptions. §12.1-20-25.
1,000 ft. from school, preschool, or child day-care premises. §2950.034.
2,000 ft. from school, “educational institution,” campsite used for children, parks, and day care facilities. §57-590. Registrants are also banned from living in the same dwelling. §57-590.1.
“Sexually violent dangerous” offenders and “predatory sex offenders” may nor reside “near locations where children are the primary occupants or users.” O.A.R. 291-202-0040.
Tier III offenders barred from schools and parks. Note: this restriction was enjoined in 2015 pending a trial on the merits.
For certain offenses against minors, may not reside w/in 1,000 ft. of school, day care center, “children’s recreational facility,” park, or playground. §23-3-535
500 ft. from school, park, public playground, or public pool. §22-24B-23.
1,000 ft. from school, day care center, child care facility, public park, playground, recreation center or athletic field, or the offender’s victim or victim’s family.
May not be on premises of a day care or preschool, public swimming pool, school, community park open to the public, playground that is open to the public.
Certain adult offenders with convictions involving minors sustained after July 2006 may not reside w/in 500 ft. of a school or parks adjacent to schools. §18.2-370.3.
Certain L2 and L3 offenders on supervision may not reside w/in 880 ft. of a school. §9.94A.030(6)
Certain registrants on supervised release for 10 yrs. or longer may not reside w/in or loiter w/in 1,000 ft. of school, child care facility, victim, or victim’s family, with exceptions. §62-12-26.
Registrants must provide notice before going on school grounds. § 301.475.

Adult registrants may not enter school grounds if s/he “has reason to believe children . . . are present and are involved in school activity or when children are presents w/in 30 mins. before or after scheduled school activity.” Various exceptions apply. §6-2-320.
